prompt.p: Iron is essential for many metabolic processes, especially for the oxygen-carrying capacity of haemoglobin.
Which one of the following is a consequence of iron deficiency?

modalFeedback.p:
Option D (Microcytic hypochromic anaemia) is Correct. Iron deficiency anaemia can occur with dietary deficiency, increased demand or excessive blood loss, and results in a microcytic hypochromic anaemia.
Option A (Microcytic normochromic anaemia) is Incorrect. Normocytic anaemias are associated with renal failure.
Option B (Normocytic normochromic anaemia) is Incorrect. Normocytic normochromic anaemia is associated with acute blood loss or chronic disease.
Option C (Macrocytic anaemia) is Incorrect. Macrocytic anaemia is associated with vitamin B deficiency: folate and B 12 .
Option E (Macrocytic hypochromic anaemia) is Incorrect. Macrocytic hypochromic anaemia may be due to marrow failure.
